info.title: Security API reference
info.description:
Configure and manage security features like Security Groups, Rules, Certificates etc.

 API Objects are: App FirewallProfile SGPolicy SecurityGroup

parameters.name: O.name
parameters.description:
Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumeric or ._- characters
minimum length is 2 and maximum length is 64 characters. must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, .length of string should be between 2 and 64

parameters.name: O.tenant
parameters.description:
Tenant to which the object belongs to. This can be automatically filled in many cases based on
the tenant the user, who created the object, belongs to.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain only alphanumerics.
Minimum length is 1 and maximum length is 48 characters. must be alpha-numericslength of string should be between 1 and 48

parameters.name: O.namespace
parameters.description:
Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.
Should start and end in an alphanumeric character and can contain alphanumeric or ._- characters
maximum length is 64 characters. must start and end with alpha numeric and can have alphanumeric, -, _, .length of string should be between 2 and 64

parameters.name: O.generation-id
parameters.description:
GenerationID is the generation Id for the object. This is incremented anytime there
 is an update to the user intent, including Spec update and any update to ObjectMeta.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.resource-version
parameters.description:
Resource version in the object store. This is updated anytime there is any change to the object.
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.uuid
parameters.description:
UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This is generated on creation of the object.
System generated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.creation-time
parameters.description:
CreationTime is the creation time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.mod-time
parameters.description:
ModTime is the Last Modification time of the object
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: O.self-link
parameters.description:
SelfLink is a link for accessing this object. When the object is served from the API-GW it is the
 URI path. Example:
   - "/v1/tenants/tenants/tenant2" 
 System generated and updated, not updatable by user.

parameters.name: label-selector
parameters.description: LabelSelector to select on labels in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-selector
parameters.description: FieldSelector to select on field values in list or watch results.

parameters.name: field-change-selector
parameters.description: FieldChangeSelector specifies to generate a watch notification on change in field(s) specified.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
from represents the start offset (zero based), used for pagination.
results returned would be in the range [from ... from+max-results-1].

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: max. number of events to be fetched for the request.

parameters.name: sort-order
parameters.description: order to sort List results in.

parameters.name: spec.timeout
parameters.description: Timeout specifies for how long the connection be kept before removing the flow entry, specified in string as '200s', '5m', etc.

parameters.name: icmp.type
parameters.description: ICMP Type.

parameters.name: icmp.code
parameters.description: ICMP Code is sub-command for a given ICMP Type.

parameters.name: dns.drop-multi-question-packets
parameters.description: Drop packet if number of questions is more than one.

parameters.name: dns.drop-large-domain-name-packets
parameters.description: Drop if domain name size is > 255 bytes.

parameters.name: dns.drop-long-label-packets
parameters.description: Drop if label length is 64 bytes or higher.

parameters.name: dns.max-message-length
parameters.description: Maximum message length, default value is 512, maximum specified user value is 8129.

parameters.name: dns.query-response-timeout
parameters.description: Timeout for DHCP Query, default 60s.

parameters.name: ftp.allow-mismatch-ip-address
parameters.description: Allow Mismatch IP Address in the payload compared to what is present in the IP header.

parameters.name: status.attached-policies
parameters.description: List of security group policies attached to the app.

parameters.name: spec.session-idle-timeout
parameters.description: Session idle timeout removes/deletes the session/flow if there is inactivity; this value is superceded by any value specified in App object. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-connection-setup-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Connection Setup Timeout is the period TCP session is kept to see the response of a SYN. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-close-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Close Timeout is the time for which TCP session is kept after a FIN is seen. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-half-closed-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Half Closed Timeout is the time for which tCP session is kept when connection is half closed i.e. FIN sent by FIN_Ack not received. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-drop-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied TCP flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.udp-drop-timeout
parameters.description: UDP Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied UDP flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.icmp-drop-timeout
parameters.description: ICMP Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied ICMP flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.drop-timeout
parameters.description: Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied non tcp/udp/icmp flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-timeout
parameters.description: Tcp Timeout is the period for which a TCP session is kept alive during inactivity. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.udp-timeout
parameters.description: Udp Timeout is the period for which a UDP session is kept alive during inactivity. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.icmp-timeout
parameters.description: Icmp Timeout is the period for which a ICMP session is kept alive during inactivity. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: propagation-status.generation-id
parameters.description: The Generation ID this status is for.

parameters.name: propagation-status.updated
parameters.description: The number of Naples that this version has already been pushed to.

parameters.name: propagation-status.pending
parameters.description: Number of Naples pending. If this is 0 it can be assumed that everything is up to date.

parameters.name: propagation-status.min-version
parameters.description: The Version running on the slowest Naples.

parameters.name: propagation-status.status
parameters.description: Textual description of propagation status.

parameters.name: propagation-status.pending-dscs
parameters.description: list of smartnics where propagation did not complete.

parameters.name: spec.session-idle-timeout
parameters.description: Session idle timeout removes/deletes the session/flow if there is inactivity; this value is superceded by any value specified in App object. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-connection-setup-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Connection Setup Timeout is the period TCP session is kept to see the response of a SYN. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-close-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Close Timeout is the time for which TCP session is kept after a FIN is seen. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-half-closed-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Half Closed Timeout is the time for which tCP session is kept when connection is half closed i.e. FIN sent by FIN_Ack not received. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-drop-timeout
parameters.description: TCP Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied TCP flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.udp-drop-timeout
parameters.description: UDP Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied UDP flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.icmp-drop-timeout
parameters.description: ICMP Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied ICMP flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.drop-timeout
parameters.description: Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied non tcp/udp/icmp flow. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.tcp-timeout
parameters.description: Tcp Timeout is the period for which a TCP session is kept alive during inactivity. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.udp-timeout
parameters.description: Udp Timeout is the period for which a UDP session is kept alive during inactivity. should be a valid time duration

parameters.name: spec.icmp-timeout
parameters.description: Icmp Timeout is the period for which a ICMP session is kept alive during inactivity. should be a valid time duration

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name whose content describes the type of the
serialized protocol buffer message.

For URLs which use the scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, the
following restrictions and interpretations apply:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* The last segment of the URL's path must represent the fully
  qualified name of the type (as in `path/google.protobuf.Duration`).
  The name should be in a canonical form (e.g., leading "." is
  not accepted).
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

key.description: The label key that the condition applies to.

values.description:
Values contains one or more values corresponding to the label key. "equals" and
"notEquals" operators need a single Value. "in" and "notIn" operators can have
one or more values.

labelsRequirement.description: Requirement defines a single matching condition for a selector.

labelsSelector.description:
Selector is used to select objects by labels. Requirements in the selector are ANDed.
A selector with no Requirements does not select anything.

spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the certificate.

status.description: Status contains the current state of the certificate.

securityCertificate.title: Certificate represents a certificate with associated chain of trust

securityCertificateList.title: CertificateList is a container object for list of Certificate objects

description.title: Description of the purpose of this certificate

usages.description:
Usage can be "client", "server" or "trust-root" in any combination.
A "server" certificate is used by a server to authenticate itself to the client
A "client" certificate is used by a client to authenticate itself to a server
A "trust-root" certificate is self-signed and is only used to validate
certificates presented by peers.
"client" and "server" certificates are always accompanied by a private key,
whereas "trust-root"-only certificates are not.

body.title: Body of the certificate in PEM encoding

trust-chain.description:
Trust chain of the certificate in PEM encoding.
These certificates are treated opaquely. We do not process them in any way
other than decoding them for informational purposes.

validity.description:
Status of the certificate: "valid", "invalid", "expired"
"invalid" means that the signature of the certificate does not match or
there are inconsistencies in the trust chain.

workloads.title: The workloads where this certificate has been deployed

drop-multi-question-packets.title: Drop packet if number of questions is more than one

drop-large-domain-name-packets.title: Drop if domain name size is > 255 bytes

drop-long-label-packets.title: Drop if label length is 64 bytes or higher

max-message-length.title: Maximum message length, default value is 512, maximum specified user value is 8129

securityFirewallProfileList.title: FirewallProfileList is a container object for list of FirewallProfile objects

session-idle-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration
session-idle-timeout.title: Session idle timeout removes/deletes the session/flow if there is inactivity; this value is superceded by any value specified in App object

tcp-connection-setup-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration
tcp-connection-setup-timeout.title: TCP Connection Setup Timeout is the period TCP session is kept to see the response of a SYN

tcp-close-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration
tcp-close-timeout.title: TCP Close Timeout is the time for which TCP session is kept after a FIN is seen

tcp-half-closed-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration
tcp-half-closed-timeout.title: TCP Half Closed Timeout is the time for which tCP session is kept when connection is half closed i.e. FIN sent by FIN_Ack not received

tcp-drop-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration
tcp-drop-timeout.title: TCP Drop Timeout is the period for which a drop entry is installed for a denied TCP flow

udp-drop-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration

icmp-drop-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration

icmp-timeout.description: should be a valid time duration
